column1: I live at No. —— Twenty-sixth Street
column2: in New York. The house is in some respects a curious one. It has enjoyed for the last two years the reputation of being haunted. It is a large and stately residence
column3: surrounded by what was once a garden
column4: but which is now only a green enclosure used for bleaching clothes. The dry basin of what has been a fountain
column5: and a few fruit trees ragged and unpruned
column6: indicate that this spot in past days was a pleasant
column8: filled with fruits and flowers and the sweet murmur of waters.The house is very spacious. A hall of noble size leads to a large spiral staircase winding through its center
column9: while the various apartments are of imposing dimensions. It was built some fifteen or twenty years since by Mr. A——
column11: who five years ago threw the commercial world into convulsions by a stupendous bank fraud. Mr. A——

column16: the report spread in Twenty-sixth Street that No. —— was haunted.
